definition: exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: As a kind of typical phonetic language, English is rich in musical and rhythmical features.
sentences.chinese: 英語作爲表音語言，富有音樂性及韻律感。

sentences.english: In addition to phonetic signs, Linear B also has several logograms.
sentences.chinese: 除了表音符號之外，線形文字B中還有一些語標符號。

sentences.english: The nature of the cipher is a fascinating theoretical question.
sentences.chinese: 表音密碼的性質是個令人着迷的理論性問題。

sentences.english: The Manchu script belongs to the table sound writing system, and its letter has two features of both syllable and phonemes.
sentences.chinese: 滿文屬於表音文字系統，其字母具有音節音位兩相性。

sentences.english: Pictophonetic characters are not phonographic, but ideographic in their word forms.
sentences.chinese: 形聲字並非表音文字，其字體結構依然遵循表義原則。

sentences.english: Scripts where symbols matched consonants or syllables allowed you to exchange symbols for sounds.
sentences.chinese: 符號與輔音或音節對應的文字能用來表音。

sentences.english: Hiragana This is the unique phonography of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 這是日本的獨特表音文字。

sentences.english: Though pictographs indicate meanings, they do not show how they should be pronounced.
sentences.chinese: 儘管象形字可以表意，但它們並不表音。

definition: phonetic component of a Chinese character
pictogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
ideogram plus phonetic (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/also known as phonogram, phonetic compound or picto-phonetic character
semantic component of a phono-semantic character (e.g. component刂[dao1] in 刻[ke4])
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds
semantic component of a phono-semantic character (e.g. component刂[dao1] in 刻[ke4])
